thread.title: BYU football: East Carolina in 6 numbers
thread.title_full: BYU football: East Carolina in 6 numbers

title: BYU football: East Carolina in 6 numbers
text:
Oct. 10, 5:30 p.m. 1 Day 3 Hrs 38 Mins 21 Secs 
East Carolina, BYU 's opponent this weekend, is not a big-name program, but the Cougars will undoubtedly have their hands full with the underrated Pirates. 
ECU is no pushover. It already boasts a win over Virginia Tech and a near upset against No. 11 Florida. The Pirates have the tools to spoil BYU's homecoming, making for a great game. 
Here are six important numbers that could have an impact on the Pirates-Cougars matchup. 1,107 
Quarterback Blake Kemp has already racked up 1,107 passing yards this season, and in the last few games, he hasn't even been ECU's main quarterback. Despite being the starter all season, he has been benched in favor of backup James Summers early in the last two games. 4 
Outside linebacker Montese Overton was named the AAC's Defensive Player of the Week after tallying four sacks against SMU , a new conference record. BYU's offensive, which ranks second-to-last in the FBS in sacks allowed this season, may have one of its toughest tests of the year this weekend. 254 
Summers has played less than six quarters in ECU's last two games, but he's racked up 254 rushing yards and four touchdowns in that span. No, they aren't Taysom vs. Texas numbers, but Summers is still a talented dual-threat quarterback who could be a headache for BYU's defense. 147 
Chris Hairston, ECU's leading rusher, has tallied only 147 total rushing yards against the Pirates' FBS opponents. BYU has given up big games to solid running backs this season, including Michigan's De'Veon Bell and UCLA 's Paul Perkins, but Hairston shouldn't pose too much of a challenge for the Cougs. 192 
East Carolina's defense ranks 95th in the FBS in rushing yards allowed, surrendering over 190 per game. With healthy running backs returning in BYU's backfield, BYU offensive coordinator Robert Anae should be excited to face ECU's front seven. 55 
ECU leads the FBS in third-down conversion percentage, capitalizing on 55 percent of its attempts. The Cougs have struggled at times this season to lock down and end opponents' drives, and the Pirates could exploit that. Email: bensonsamb@gmail.com ; Twitter: @sambbenson. Recommended Stories
